explanation: Global Witness is an international NGO that investigates the exploitation of natural resources and its impact on conflict, poverty, corruption, and human rights. It focuses on issues like illegal logging, conflict diamonds, and corruption in the oil, gas, and mining industries. They campaign for climate justice and against misinformation. I have based my answer on the content of the documents provided, especially [this wikipedia article](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Global_Witness) and their [homepage](https://www.globalwitness.org/en/).

SOCAR (State Oil Company of the Republic of Azerbaijan) is a state-owned national oil and gas company. It's involved in exploration, production, refining, and transportation of oil and gas. This clearly places it within the fossil fuel industry. See: [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SOCAR](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SOCAR)

Lenovo is a multinational technology company specializing in designing, manufacturing, and marketing consumer electronics, personal computers, software, servers, and related services. It is not involved in the fossil fuel industry, is not a conservation group, government, or educational institution. The company's website is lenovo.com. [https://www.lenovo.com/us/en/] and [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenovo]
